```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(tmap)
library(sf)

sf::sf_use_s2(FALSE)

tmap_mode('view')
```

```{r load-data-quietly, echo=FALSE}
#Get map data for comparisons

shefBorders_Here <-
  '../cleaned data/makeFile01 sheffield borders+frontiers.rds'
shef_borders <-
  shefBorders_Here %>% readRDS

ukgrid = "+init=epsg:27700"


## Get the points and make them them into geoms and attach to a sf obj
rotherham_station  <- 
  c(442547, 392958)
other_point <- 
  c(442632, 393131)

p1 <-
  st_point(
    rotherham_station
  ) %>% 
  st_buffer(10)

p2 <-
  st_point(
    other_point
  ) %>% 
  st_buffer(10)

## Set boundbox to fix issues
bBox <- 
  p2 %>%
  st_buffer(2e3) %>%
  st_sfc(
    crs = st_crs(ukgrid)
  )

points_geom <-
  st_sfc(
    p1,
    p2,
    crs = st_crs(ukgrid)
  )

points_sf <-
  st_sf(
    map = 2:1,
    geometry = points_geom
  )


```

This initial exercise is in place to help you to familiarise yourself with using interactive maps ahead of the main exercise.

``` {r make-map-quietly, echo = FALSE}

tm_shape(
  points_sf,
  name = 'Points',
  bbox =tmaptools::bb(bBox)
  ) +
  tm_borders(
#    size = 0.05, # default = 0.02
    lwd = 10,
    col = 'purple') +
  tm_facets('map', sync = T) 


```

**Instructions**: Look at the purple point in each map. Which map contains the point closest to Rotherham central station?

**Hints**:

- Use the button pictured to open the OpenStreetMap layer to enable you to view locations.
